data.title: Shakira and her children's new life in Miami: She will have a private mansion for her whole family

data.text:
Although the last few days in Barcelona were not the best for Shakira, after receiving the eviction letter signed by her former father-in-law, Joan Pique, to leave the residence where she was living in Barcelona.

However, now that she has made peace with her separation from the former Barcelona defender, the future for the Colombian looks very bright.

It seems that the musician could be invited to the Met Gala this year, which would be her first time at the event.

In addition, she will move into her residence in an exclusive neighborhood in Miami with her children and family.

As for Milan and Sasha, the children will attend the exclusive Miami Country Day, considered one of the 20 best schools in the state of Florida and with students from 40 different countries, with an annual cost of between 32,000 and 47,000 dollars, according to Mujer Hoy.

The family home will be a mansion

Shakira and her children's Miami home is located on North Bay Road Drive in South Beach, an island where Jennifer Lopez and Ricky Martin also live.

The mansion, which has several buildings, a swimming pool, private jetty and views of the bay, was recently adapted to add walls of vegetation to prevent the paparazzi from obtaining images of the interior.

Shakira will be very sheltered in Miami

The singer will be able to enjoy a much larger network of family and friends in Miami than in Barcelona, where she was only close to Gerard Pique's family.

While in the American city she will have her brother Tonino, her manager and right-hand man, close to her. As well as her sister Lucy Mebarak. Undoubtedly Shakira and her children will have the affection and closeness of her siblings and cousins.

Shakira is also close to Gloria and Emilio Estefan, two of the city's historical figures. She will also be able to count on Juan Luis Guerra, Chris Martin and Gustavo Cerati.

In addition, it is expected that she will continue to move forward musically, creating new hits to complete the long-awaited new album that will take her on a world tour.
